trans1hppatransDRA TDF to HP PA-RISC translatorhppatrans-Dswitch-hinput-fileoutput-filehppatrans-V-Aswitch-Cswitch-Fswitch-Iswitch-Kstr-Mswitch-Rswitch-Uswitch-X-Bswitch-E-H-P-Q-Wswitch-ZDescription
The code production portion of the TDF compiler is under the control of a TDF translator, which translates a TDF capsule into assembly.
There are separate TDF translators for each target architecture.
hppatrans produces assembly code for the HP PA-RISC machines.
The various different translators are referred to collectively as trans.
It is recommended that trans should not be invoked directly, but via the user interface tcc1. The file -opt can be passed to trans by passing the option -Wt,-opt to tcc1.Options
The options denoted by a capital letter are common to the TDF installers for all the architectures, although the defaults vary for each translator.
Lowercase options are specific to each translator.
The options -h and -d are specific to hppatrans.
switch stands for either 0, to switch an option off, or 1, to switch it on.

Optimisation-specific common options
The common options pertaining to optimisation are:-Aswitch
This option determines whether trans should inline calls to alloca.
For hppatrans, this is done by default.-Cswitch
This option determines whether trans should apply the "constants out of loops" optimisation.
For hppatrans, this is done by default.-Fswitch
For hppatrans, this option determines whether the "for all" optimisation should be applied.
For hppatrans, this is done by default.-Iswitch
This option determines whether trans should apply the "inlining" optimisation.
For hppatrans, this is done by default.-Kstr
Causes trans to optimise its code for a particular processor model, determined by str.
For hppatrans, at present there are no valid values for str.-Mswitch
If this option is on, trans preserves division by a floating point number rather than replacing it by multiplication by the reciprocal of the number. While the latter produces faster code, it may lead to rounding errors.
For hppatrans, by default, division by constants is preserved.-Rswitch
This option determines whether trans should immediately round every floating point operation to its appropriate range. This produces slower code, but is necessary for strict IEEE conformance.
The default is to round after every operation for hppatrans.-Uswitch
This option determines whether trans should apply the "loop unrolling" optimisation.
For hppatrans, this is done by default.-X
This option disables all optimisations. All trans' optimisations are believed to be valid, so that any error in optimisation is a genuine bug.
Various optimisations are performed by default for hppatrans.Other common options
Common options not related to optimisation are:-Bswitch
This option determines whether trans should report floating point constants which exceed their range.
For hppatrans, this is done by default.
If this option is switched off such constants are replaced by infinity.-Dswitch
This option determines whether trans should produce Position Independent Code (PIC).
For hppatrans, this is not done by default.
For hppatrans, the translator-specific option -dswitch is also provided. The -D flag emulates cc's +Z flag, -d emulates cc's +z flag. Neither option has yet been tested.-E
This option disables trans' constant overflow checks.
For hppatrans, this is done by default.-H
This option causes trans to output debugging information in its output file. This will only work if the input TDF capsule contains debugging information.
For hppatrans, the -H flag causes hppatrans to output xdb compatible debugging information in its output file. This option is only available if the header file hpux_symtab.h was included whilst compiling hppatrans.
hpux_symtab.h is available by anonymous FTP, but appears to have changed location over time. Your best option is to simply google for it.
Please note well that there is a known bug in the -H option for hppatrans. The bug sometimes prohibits xdb reading selective diagnostic information from a suite of two or more modules linked together.
Debugging information is not output by default for hppatrans.-P
This option causes trans to output profiling information suitable for use with prof1 or a similar tool (see individual manual pages for details).
Profiling information is not output by default for hppatrans.-Q
This option causes trans to quit before processing its input files. This is particularly useful in conjunction with -V.
For hppatrans, this is not done by default.-V
This option causes trans to print its version number and the version of the TDF specification it supports.
For hppatrans, this is not done by default.-Wswitch
This option determines whether trans should make string literals writable. At present the C producer does not make use of this facility.
For hppatrans, at present all string literals are writable, and this cannot be altered.-Z
This option causes trans to print the version number of all the TDF capsules it decodes.
For hppatrans, this is not done by default.Translator-specific options
The following options are specific to hppatrans:-h
The -h flag causes hppatrans to output gdb compatible, i.e. stabs, debugging information in its output file. The -h flag is believed to be valid—any error is a genuine bug.
The -H and -h options will only work if the input TDF capsule contains debugging information.See Also
